name: 2024 FA Clinical Care Guidelines Screening Indicator Set (Table 1)
description: Manifestations listed in Table 1 of the 5th edition Fanconi Anemia Clinical Care Guidelines that should raise suspicion for FA and trigger diagnostic screening workup.
notes: This is a screening definition/case-identification aid. Definitive FA diagnosis still requires confirmatory genetic and/or chromosome breakage testing.
scope: Suspected Fanconi anemia in pediatric and adult clinical settings

name: 2015 IPND NMOSD Diagnostic Criteria (Adults)
description: International consensus diagnostic criteria for NMOSD, stratified by AQP4-IgG status.
notes: Criteria elements summarized from Table 1 (adult NMOSD diagnostic criteria) in Wingerchuk et al. 2015 (PMCID: PMC4515040).
scalar_fields_json: {"definition_type": "DIAGNOSTIC_CRITERIA", "description": "International consensus diagnostic criteria for NMOSD, stratified by AQP4-IgG status.", "name": "2015 IPND NMOSD Diagnostic Criteria (Adults)", "notes": "Criteria elements summarized from Table 1 (adult NMOSD diagnostic criteria) in Wingerchuk et al. 2015 (PMCID: PMC4515040).", "scope": "Adult patients"}
complex_fields_json: {"criteria_sets": [{"core_clinical_characteristics": [{"preferred_term": "Optic neuritis", "term": {"id": "HP:0100653", "label": "Optic neuritis"}}, {"description": "Acute inflammatory myelitis.", "preferred_term": "Acute myelitis", "term": {"id": "HP:0012486", "label": "Myelitis"}}, {"description": "Episode of otherwise unexplained hiccups or nausea and vomiting.", "preferred_term": "Area postrema syndrome", "term": {"id": "HP:0002017", "label": "Nausea and vomiting"}}, {"preferred_term": "Acute brainstem syndrome"}, {"description": "With NMOSD-typical diencephalic MRI lesions.", "preferred_term": "Symptomatic narcolepsy or acute diencephalic syndrome"}, {"description": "With NMOSD-typical brain lesions.", "preferred_term": "Symptomatic cerebral syndrome"}], "description": "Criteria when AQP4-IgG is detected.", "exclusion_criteria": [{"preferred_term": "Alternative diagnoses excluded"}], "laboratory_requirements": [{"description": "Positive test using best available detection method (cell-based assay recommended).", "preferred_term": "AQP4-IgG positive"}], "minimum_required": 1, "name": "NMOSD with AQP4-IgG"}, {"additional_requirements": [{"description": "At least one core clinical characteristic must be optic neuritis, acute myelitis with longitudinally extensive transverse myelitis (LETM), or area postrema syndrome.", "preferred_term": "At least one key core characteristic"}, {"description": "Two or more different core clinical characteristics.", "preferred_term": "Dissemination in space"}], "core_clinical_characteristics": [{"preferred_term": "Optic neuritis", "term": {"id": "HP:0100653", "label": "Optic neuritis"}}, {"description": "Acute inflammatory myelitis.", "preferred_term": "Acute myelitis", "term": {"id": "HP:0012486", "label": "Myelitis"}}, {"description": "Episode of otherwise unexplained hiccups or nausea and vomiting.", "preferred_term": "Area postrema syndrome", "term": {"id": "HP:0002017", "label": "Nausea and vomiting"}}, {"preferred_term": "Acute brainstem syndrome"}, {"description": "With NMOSD-typical diencephalic MRI lesions.", "preferred_term": "Symptomatic narcolepsy or acute diencephalic syndrome"}, {"description": "With NMOSD-typical brain lesions.", "preferred_term": "Symptomatic cerebral syndrome"}], "description": "Criteria for seronegative or untested AQP4-IgG.", "exclusion_criteria": [{"preferred_term": "Alternative diagnoses excluded"}], "imaging_requirements": [{"description": "Brain MRI normal or only nonspecific white matter lesions, or optic nerve MRI with T2-hyperintense or T1-weighted gadolinium-enhancing lesion extending over >1/2 optic nerve length or involving optic chiasm.", "preferred_term": "Acute optic neuritis MRI requirement"}, {"description": "Intramedullary MRI lesion extending over >=3 contiguous segments (LETM), or >=3 contiguous segments of focal spinal cord atrophy with history compatible with acute myelitis.", "preferred_term": "Acute myelitis MRI requirement"}, {"description": "Associated dorsal medulla/area postrema lesions.", "preferred_term": "Area postrema syndrome MRI requirement"}, {"description": "Associated periependymal brainstem lesions.", "preferred_term": "Acute brainstem syndrome MRI requirement"}], "laboratory_requirements": [{"description": "Negative test using best available detection method, or testing unavailable.", "preferred_term": "AQP4-IgG negative or testing unavailable"}], "minimum_required": 2, "name": "NMOSD without AQP4-IgG or unknown status"}]}

name: OHDSI Phenotype Library: Earliest event of Rheumatoid Arthritis
description: OHDSI cohort definition that indexes the first ever rheumatoid arthritis event in history, using a concept set spanning condition and observation domains, with cohort exit at the end of continuous observation.
notes: Source: OHDSI forum phenotype submission "Rheumatoid Arthritis" (logic description and evaluation notes); imported to the OHDSI Phenotype Library (expected id 858).

name: Clinical presentation summary (StatPearls)
description: Transverse myelitis (TM) is a rare, acquired focal inflammatory disorder often presenting with rapid onset weakness, sensory deficits, and bowel/bladder dysfunction.
